core

Class StringTyped

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.UserAction
      • core.StringTyped

  • public class StringTyped
extends UserAction
    Listen for a certain sequence of characters (like multiple KeyTypeds after each other). Can be created by behaviors using UserActionFactory.
    Author:
    csiki

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private KeyReader keyReader
      Instance of KeyReader.
      private int state
      Number of keys typed from the expected sequence.
      private java.lang.String stringExpected
      The expected sequence of characters to be typed.
      private boolean stringTyped
      True if the sequence is typed, false otherwise.

      • Fields inherited from class core.UserAction

        behavior

      StringTyped constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate(Behavior behavior)
      Activates StringTyped, so it listens for key hits.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivates StringTyped, so it won't listen for key hits.

      Gets if the sequence of characters (string) is already typed.

        Number of keys typed from the expected sequence.

        The expected sequence of characters to be typed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringTyped

        public StringTyped(java.lang.String stringExpected,
           KeyReader keyReader)
        StringTyped constructor.
        Parameters:
        stringExpected - sequence of character expected to be typed.
        keyReader - KeyReader instance.

    • Method Detail

      • isStringTyped

        public boolean isStringTyped()
        Gets if the sequence of characters (string) is already typed.
        Returns:
        true if string is typed (after StringTyped had activated), false otherwise.

      • update

        public void update()
        KeyReader calls it if new key is hit. Behavior should NOT call it!
        Specified by:
        update in class UserAction

      • activate

        public void activate(Behavior behavior)
        Activates StringTyped, so it listens for key hits. Should be activated after created by behavior!
        Specified by:
        activate in class UserAction

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates StringTyped, so it won't listen for key hits. Can be called by behavior but automatically called by itself if the expected key is hit (after had been activated ofc.).
        Specified by:
        deactivate in class UserAction
